alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Windsor County through 600 PM EDT... At 459 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hartland, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodstock, Hartland Four Corners, Woodstock Village, Hartland, Quechee, Hartford, West Windsor, Windsor, Queechee State Park, Taftsville, North Hartland Dam Recreation Area, South Woodstock, and North Hartland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 91 between mile markers 58 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern Vermont.
